message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.AI, cs.CL 

This paper deals with a novel pooling scheme for convolutional neural networks in the context of image classification, which is a common application of computer vision (cs.CV). The paper also discusses the use of gradient-based optimization to learn the weights for the pooling scheme, which is a common technique in machine learning (cs.LG) and neural networks (cs.NE). Additionally, the paper introduces a new approach to preserving information in downsampling, which could be relevant to researchers working on improving the efficiency and accuracy of deep learning models (cs.AI). Finally, the paper's focus on image classification and feature maps suggests that it may also be relevant to researchers working on natural language processing and text classification tasks (cs.CL).
